website_summaries.verdict: Made in the U.S. by a name brand, this nygar (thistle) seed is beloved by all kinds of finches.
pros: There are a whopping 150,000 seeds per pound, with no dust, filler or any wastage – plus, the seeds are non-germinating
cons: The seeds are small, so the feed needs to be used in a fine tube feeder

customer_reviews.title: 50LB bag of Junk
customer_reviews.text: This arrived at my house with the external packaging beat up with the entire box covered in tape. The internal packaging consisted of a wrapper from some sort of inflatable insulation system (garbage) and a trash bag tied in a knot, with a 50 lb (maybe) bag of ripped open paper with nyjer seeds spilling out and all over. This is utterly unusable - not what I paid for. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew F Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Best price.
customer_reviews.text: The finches in my yard are eating me out of house and home. We had a fire in a nearby rural park and I think my little friends were displaced. This seed is no different than the bags from the local big box and mine quit carrying even the small bags. I needed quantity anyway so I went for bulk at the lowest price. It's the best deal around. Just beware that the bag is heavy and a little unwieldy so I loaded part of it in a smaller container.
customer_reviews.author: Cow Town Girl

customer_reviews.title: Birds not so impressed
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't keep up with the finches using the small bags of Nyjer Thistle seed, so I decided to buy bulk. Thee is no comparison. I have an occasional finch, but not the crowd that had been hanging around so faithfully. This seed is relatively clean, but just not drawing the birds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nyger seed
customer_reviews.text: The info said "clean". Nope... a lot of crap in it. I probably won't order this item again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Norgard

customer_reviews.title: Birds Didn't Like It
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product's price, but the birds didn't like it at all. And they're the ones that mattered in this case. So it's back to Brand X from the BigBox store - it's about 4¢/lb more, but apparently it's the preferred seed. I even did a bird taste test since I wasn't stoked about having to dump 30lb of seed. Brand X feeders were covered with finches, this stuff wasn't. Once the seed dries out, the birds don't want it anymore. So buying in bulk didn't work, even if the price was right and the birds go through 10lb every week - in the end, uneaten seed was just wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Ensign Chekov

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. It may have been one out of a ...
customer_reviews.text: Been purchasing Wagner's Nyjer Thistle Seed in smaller quantities. Thought this would save me money. I can only describe the product as 3rd rate. It's appearance is so different, dried out not dark and oily look and not clean. When filling feeder it got plugged up fast with small twigs and dirt. Very disappointed. It may have been one out of a million bags but I'll never try another to see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The birds love this seed 🐦
customer_reviews.text: The birds love this stuff. I have 3 socks filled with this seeds and they are fighting over it. It’s such a great price, product and fast ship! 👍👍 Update: I dropped a couple of stars off this product, the 1st time I purchased it, it was a great price, but every time afterwards (3 times total) the price has gone up by $10. I just bought it about a week ago, now it’s $10 more again, What’s the deal? I’m going to have to find another supplier. I can’t afford this anymore. 😞
customer_reviews.author: Chevychicky

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: We have lots of little goldfinches on our place and have been feeding these Nyer seeds . Used to buy this in small quantities and it got expensive. Now we found these 50 lbs bags and we’re happy because it is a lot more affordable! We order and the bags arrive with UPS in a few days in excellent condition. Happy we found this !a
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle C. Heynekamp

customer_reviews.title: good product, But a $40.00 increase in price is Way too much.
customer_reviews.text: This Nyjer seed is a little dirty than other premium seed, but the bulk price $52.00 was worth the cost for 50 pounds, two days after buying the seed the price went up by $10.00 for 50 pounds,to $62.00 , and now $ 89.00 I find that $ 40.00 price increase to be out of order, even for Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Muetzel

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: We have so may birds that we go through a 10 pound bag in the blink of an eye. It is so great to be able to buy a 50 pound bag of Nyger seed. Product shipped on time, and was packaged accordingly. Birds love it! We are already halfway through the bag after just a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael postiff

customer_reviews.title: Gold finches love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our gold finches can't get enough of this stuff. We have to fill out feeder 2-3 times a week to keep them sated. It definitely trails off if you let it go stale by only filling it once a week or fewer times, based on the number of birds we would get.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: finches love it!
customer_reviews.text: House, Lesser and American Goldfinches go crazy for this feed. It's expensive but effective. They must be treated to avoid sprouting which is appreciated. I advise bringing in the feeders during rainfall or the seeds clump up and aren't nearly as attractive afterwards. 50# seems like a lot of feed but they gobble it up, one seed at a time, at a furious rate!
customer_reviews.author: metalfisherman

customer_reviews.title: Wagner bulk seed (50lb bag) is great seed for wild finches
customer_reviews.text: I started off purchasing Finch seed from Amazon (25 lb bag), Amazon and the mfg. did not state that this was for "pet Finch's only". Called Amazon and they were so great refunded my money without any hassle. I then purchased the Wagner 50lb bag since our wild finch community eat the seed quickly. I was a bit concerned after the initial "pet Finch only" situation but this Wagner Nyjer seed is good quality and the birds really like it!
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: BEST QUALITY & BEST PRICE FOR NYJER SEED!
customer_reviews.text: My birds love this food, and it is the lowest price on the entire Internet! I did not hesitate to buy it because of the Wagner name. Most of their products are the BEST, except for the Striped sunflower Seeds (which are the smallest I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Darbe

customer_reviews.title: They will last.
customer_reviews.text: The last bag kept the Goldie's eating for 3 years. To store during the off season I kept a large plastic drinking cup stuffed with paper towels and filled with water then tightly sealed the bag checking the water every 6 weeks. I live in Tucson where it's a bit dry.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Best price per pound I could find
customer_reviews.text: While a 50 pound bag is hard to handle it's definitely the best price. Quality of the seed is excellent...very little debris. I go through a bag in about 6 months so worth the effort...and shipping is free!! Latest purchase came in a large box. When opened I found the seed bag ripped open and the seed spilled. Not sure what happened but I suspect UPS tore the bag and put it in the box rather than own up. Wish I had a picture but had my seed so just dumped it in a can.
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good product but the price has doubled.
customer_reviews.text: I feel lucky that I purchased this item when I did because the price has doubled since then. It’s still a good product but a little too expensive for me now.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Y.

customer_reviews.title: good quality and price
customer_reviews.text: The quality is consistent with the smaller bags and the price can't be beat. Allow plenty of time for delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Good seed!  Watch for price up-ticks 😉
customer_reviews.text: Very, very clean and fresh seed, I’ll be back to buy more! 👍🤠. Well time to update, birds love the seed, burned through my first bag in a month, came back to buy a second bag, price jump, purchased another sellers product
customer_reviews.author: Jay F.

customer_reviews.title: Wagner's is excellent thistle seed and at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent thistle seed that the finches absolutely love. I had to go with the large package because there are so many finches visiting my two thistle feeders, I was having trouble keeping enough on hand. And this is a great deal. Wagner's, in a large, large bag, with a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: A finch favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is always a favorite with house and American finches in our Chicago backyard. Price was lower than at the orange home improvement store, where I used to get it from
customer_reviews.author: Duppie

customer_reviews.title: Freshness and what 'it' is
customer_reviews.text: The package came well packaged, and with very good storing suggestions. It fit perfectly into a metal garbage can. Put in a scooper and there you go. Keep the birds and their families full.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value and birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: Goldfinches love this seed. Wish they would pack into smaller amounts as this large bag is hard to handle and pour from due to the weight and no handles.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it
customer_reviews.text: Not for human consumption. The birds, however, love it. We go through a lot of seed over the summer. Price is excellent. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: DAR-FL

customer_reviews.title: Competative with low cost Nijer seeds
customer_reviews.text: About the time I first started using this product, the area was covered with forest smoke .. and since then my bird population has greatly dwindled. So ... I really don't know how the birds like it (or not!)
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Read some comment about "dirt in this ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Read some comment about "dirt in this seed' nonsense, that is just dust from millions of seeds rubbing against each other, been experiencing that with all brands of niger seed, Hope that silly comment didn't scare away any business.
customer_reviews.author: DaveCydell

customer_reviews.title: The best I've ever recieved
customer_reviews.text: The cleanest, best smelling, most stem free nyger seed I've ever bought. The finches love it!
customer_reviews.author: Wings42

customer_reviews.title: um, finches love it!
customer_reviews.text: Hadn't really planned to write a review of birdseed but I've purchased this brand of Nyjer seed regularly for a couple years and am happy with it. The lesser goldfinches around here love it and although it thistle and nyjer seed are not cheap this seems a fairly cost-effective type of finch food.
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: Convenient size to last a bit...
customer_reviews.text: Considering the amount of wild birds I feed, I'm very glad this 50lb bag is available through Prime and comes directly to my door! Pretty good price for the amount, considering that thistle seed seems to be more valuable than gold these days...
customer_reviews.author: Daniela I. Bright

customer_reviews.title: Very popular with my Lesser Goldfinches here in new Mexico
customer_reviews.text: I'm now on my second bag, happy with the purchases, little or no debris mixed with the seed. Goldfinches love it. Just be aware that a 50lb bag weighs...well...50lb...so moving it around could be awkward for some.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Magnet

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it! They empty the feeder (18" high) in ...
customer_reviews.text: Birds love it! They empty the feeder (18" high) in just over a day. However, a lot also gets wasted because is too fine for mesh feeders. I have 2 different mesh feeders and a lot just goes through the metal mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delivery Was Prompt
customer_reviews.text: For wild goldfinches. Bulk price is good. Bag can be lifted by one person. Bag fits upright into minimum space. Bag prevents moisture and mildew when closed with clamp.
customer_reviews.author: LoveSpanishHistory

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality seed at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality seed at a great price. Birds would give it thumbs up, if only they had thumbs. My only worry: I'm glad I have a strong delivery person. This is a big bag, and I hope the drivers don't mind 50 pound dead weights.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kaufmann

customer_reviews.title: Food for birds.
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged in recyclable paper bag. Finches appear to adore this feed seed.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Jess

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as before
customer_reviews.text: Great value, buying 50lb bag for a year now. Last purchase had several pieces of debris and package arrived “taped” at various places. Weight was okay but the seed is not the same quality as before.
customer_reviews.author: Jalawataan

customer_reviews.title: Very dirty and dusty
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday on time. I have ordered this same product in the past. This time the seeds are very dirty and dusty. I have transferred the seeds to the plastic containers I use for storage and have filled the feeders. I am waiting to see if the birds will eat the seeds or if they are too dirty. If too dirty I will request a refund. If they eat the seeds I will update this post.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ivener

customer_reviews.title: Nyjer seed tends to be terribly costly, in general
customer_reviews.text: Nyjer seed tends to be terribly costly, in general. If you're serious about your wild bird feeding, purchasing this large bag is worth it (at the time of this review).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bird's love them
customer_reviews.text: Seed is fresh, that is why I buy from you. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finches love it
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Will buy again when the birds use it up.
customer_reviews.author: Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: Happy birds
customer_reviews.text: Great price and our birds are the fattest and happiest on the mountain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they like it...........
customer_reviews.text: I don't reccomend sprinkling this on your breakfast cereal, but our wild gold finche eat 5lbs of this a day, so it must be very tasty to them.
customer_reviews.author: G. Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: I do not like the dust in the seed and must wear a ...
customer_reviews.text: The transition to this brand of nyjer seed was not a problem for our Golder Finches. I do not like the dust in the seed and must wear a mask when transferring it to a smaller container and into the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: BJP

customer_reviews.title: Great price for large amount!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal and purchase for this! Great value for your money!
customer_reviews.author: ZH

customer_reviews.title: Birds can't get enough!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 nyjer seed feeders and the American goldfinches and chickadees cannot get enough. Each feeder has 6 birds on it at a time and more would land if they could fit.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen E Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I had been ordering smaller bags of seeds for my very hungry finches. This larger bag meets my needs and keeps the birds happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Finch Food at good price.
customer_reviews.text: I Love to feed finches. We have the thistle socks hanging on shepherd hooks right outside our kitchen windows. This 50lb. Bag of thistle should last us for all summer. And, it was a better price than I've seen anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Cogan

customer_reviews.title: Clean & good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good seed. Finches love it. I’ve bought several bags and the seed has always been clean and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G

customer_reviews.title: The finches love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our finches and gold finches just go crazy for this! We serve it in the socks and they’re eating us outta house and home. Haha
customer_reviews.author: bob Elfort

customer_reviews.title: Great deal if it's shipped in a box.
customer_reviews.text: The goldfinches love this stuff! In a sock or cylindrical metal Nyjer feeder, once it's discovered they will come by the dozens. It is a great deal if the bags are shipped in a box as my first two bags were. However, the last order was shipped in just the paper product bag. As you would expect, the bag was torn and at least 15 lbs were lost in transit - not such a great deal now.
customer_reviews.author: KLJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Old? Tainted? Finches won't touch it!
customer_reviews.text: finches all left! i bought this because of the price and the five star reviews...cant imagine what is wrong with the batch of seed...i tired it on two different feeders...and a neighbors house. the finches wont touch it. 50 pounds of worthless birdseed!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie M. Gall

customer_reviews.title: Love it...
customer_reviews.text: I've used over 200lbs and my birds aren't showing any signs of slowing down.

customer_reviews.title: two stars

customer_reviews.title: but my Goldfinches LOVED it. Seed was clean of debris and dirt ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I didn't care much, but my Goldfinches LOVED it. Seed was clean of debris and dirt as much as it could be.

customer_reviews.title: fantastic

customer_reviews.title: I’ll certainly buy agai!
customer_reviews.text: The mix has a bit more sticks and roughage in it than I prefer, but overall it’s very good.

customer_reviews.title: Bird food
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how the bag was damaged but it was all taped. The product was fine but I’m sure some was lost but the hole in the bag!

customer_reviews.title: Buying in bulk saved me $$$

Each 50 pound bag is as good as the last and I have been ordering multiple bags per year for maybe 5 years. Always order at least 2 weeks before needed.

product_meta.title: Wagner's 62052 Nyjer Seed Wild Bird Food, 50-Pound Bag
product_meta.description: Nyjer seed (Thistle seed) is the absolute favorite of Finches, such as the American Goldfinch, Purple Finch, Pine Siskin, and other small Songbirds. This tiny delicacy is used in Finch feeders which have smaller holes and tiny perches-perfect for the Finches but discouraging to larger birds! Wagner's Nyjer seed is the ultimate choice for nurturing Finches with its high fat and protein content. Nyjer seed packs an incredible 150,000 seeds per pound and the seeds create no waste, no mess, no growth and produce more visits to your feeder. Fill your Finch feeder with Wagner's Nyjer seed and enjoy the antics of these beautiful and sociable birds in your backyard. Wagner's has been a trusted supplier of wild bird food for over 100 years.
feature_bullets: Nyjer seed is a perfect choice for nurturing finches with its high fat and protein content
Nyjer seed packs an incredible 150,000 seeds per pound
Seeds create no waste, no mess, no growth and more visits to your feeder
Use with a finch tube feeder

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars234 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
